channel.title: I feel like an idiot not know how to map for HL but...
channel.description:
Could I get some help here?
Could anyone tell me what all those wierd entities are and what they do? (I know what they are but, I want to know how to configure them in the properties box)
Also, What the heck is Max_Leaf_Faces? :brow:
And lastly, (doesn't pertain to Hammer) How can I get the music off of the Half-Life CDs. (don't just give me a download link to a site hosting the actual files. I have a slow internet connection here, so it'll take forever.) :|
Thank you for reading,
Joebama

item.title: I feel like an idiot not know how to map for HL but...
item.dc:creator: Hanzales
item.description:
I’ve learned mapping process with Qeradiant. Almost 3 years of learning. I mean learn anything from tutorials with very basic language skills are not easy. I’ve made three maps with recreated train (it was in 2001) …extremly more details and texture aligment etc… I really enjoyed creating something. Then my HDD crashed day before backuping. I’ve lost all my admire to continue. But today I feel big needs start all over again (I forgot almost everything) Maybe it’s advantage, because Hammer works a litlle bit differently then Qerad… I hope I will manage scripting objectives at least again. Animating characters and script sequences…its out of my IQ abilities

Read full topic
item.source: I feel like an idiot not know how to map for HL but...

item.title: I feel like an idiot not know how to map for HL but...
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Maxx Skywalker:

I was about to throw that in there. Yeah, just use Windows Media Player, or whatever other program you use to rip your CDs to get the songs into an MP3 format.

I know, it’s weird, but you can actually pop the game disc into a CD player, and listen to the Half Life soundtrack straight off the disc. Good thing it’s not anymore complicated than that.

Ya not many games will do that for ya. That also works for the Opposing Force and Blue Shift cds as well.

Read full topic
item.source: I feel like an idiot not know how to map for HL but...

item.title: I feel like an idiot not know how to map for HL but...
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Omega_Absolute:

Place CD in CD drive.
Open windows media player.
Click rip CD…

The programming in Half Life makes the game play music files from a cd during certain parts in Half Life. Once you no longer needed to have the CD to play HL, people started hearing music from whatever CD they did have in the drive. Needless to say, the music is saved on the Half Life CD as a regular music CD.

I was about to throw that in there. Yeah, just use Windows Media Player, or whatever other program you use to rip your CDs to get the songs into an MP3 format.

I know, it’s weird, but you can actually pop the game disc into a CD player, and listen to the Half Life soundtrack straight off the disc. Good thing it’s not anymore complicated than that.

Read full topic

item.title: I feel like an idiot not know how to map for HL but...
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Joebama:

hammer can be used for half-life 1 games also.

If you’ve figured out how to do this:
https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/GoldSource_mapping_in_Hammer_4.x

then you wouldn’t need our help with simple entity logic.

And lastly, (doesn’t pertain to Hammer) How can I get the music off of the Half-Life CDs. (don’t just give me a download link to a site hosting the actual files. I have a slow internet connection here, so it’ll take forever.)

Place CD in CD drive.
Open windows media player.
Click rip CD…

The programming in Half Life makes the game play music files from a cd during certain parts in Half Life. Once you no longer needed to have the CD to play HL, people started hearing music from whatever CD they did have in the drive. Needless to say, the music is saved on the Half Life CD as a regular music CD.

Also, What the heck is Max_Leaf_Faces?

:facepalm:
Here, let me google that for you…
https://lmgtfy.com/?q=Max_leaf_faces

Read full topic
